data.sentence: The word مَا comes from the root م ا and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.
data.sentence: The word يَقُولُونَ comes from the root ق و ل and is associated with the meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.
The word ذَا comes from the root ذ و and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: to remember/commemorate/recollect, study in order to remember, remind, bear in mind, mindful, mention/tell/relate, magnify/praise, admonish/warn (e.g. dhikra is the 2nd declenation and it is stronger than dhikr), preach, extol, give status.nobility/eminence/honour, fame, good report, cause of good reputation, means of exaltation.Male/man/masculine (dhakar, dual - dhakarain, plural - dhukur).
data.sentence: The word وَاذْكُرْ comes from the root ذ ك ر and is associated with the meanings: to remember/commemorate/recollect, study in order to remember, remind, bear in mind, mindful, mention/tell/relate, magnify/praise, admonish/warn (e.g. dhikra is the 2nd declenation and it is stronger than dhikr), preach, extol, give status.nobility/eminence/honour, fame, good report, cause of good reputation, means of exaltation.Male/man/masculine (dhakar, dual - dhakarain, plural - dhukur).

data.meanings: to bind, be patient or constant, endure patiently, steadily adhere to reason and command, restrain from what reason and law forbid, restrain from manifesting grief, agitation and impatience. The word being the contrary of jaz'a (manifestation of grief and agitation).. . Sabar (prf. 3rd. p.m. sing.): He bore with patience.. Sabaruu (prf. 3rd. p.m. plu.): They bore patiently, patiently preserved.. Sabartum (prf. 2nd. p.m. plu.): You patiently preserved.. Sabarnaa (imp. 1st. p.m. plu.): We patiently preserved.. Yasbir (imp. 3rd. p.m. sing. fuss.): He patiently preserves.. Tasbiru (imp. 2nd. p.m. sing. fuss.): You have patience.. Tasbiruuna/Tasbiruu (acc. /imp. 2nd. p.m. plu. juss.): You will patiently preserve.. . Nasbira imp. neg. 1st. p. plu. ): We will not at all remain content.. Nasbiranna (imp. 1st. p. plu.): We will surely endure patiently.. Isbir (prt. m. sing.): Preserve thou (in doing good); Bear patiently; Wait thou patiently.. Isbiruu (prt. in. plu.): Be patiently preserving.. Saabiruu (prt. m. plu. III): Strive to excel in being patiently preserving.. Istabir (prt. in. plu. sing.): Be steadfast.. Sabrun/Sabran (acc./ v. n.): Patience.. Saabiruun/ Saabiriin (acc. /act. pic. plu.): Those who are calm and steadfast.. Saabiratun (act. plc. f sing.): Preserving one f.. Saabiraat (act. plc. f. plu.): Preserving women.. Asbara (elative.) : How very enduring.. Sabaar (ints. sing.): Patiently preserving.. Saabiran (act. pic. m. sing. acc.): Patient.
data.sentence: The word اصْبِرْ comes from the root ص ب ر and is associated with the meanings: to bind, be patient or constant, endure patiently, steadily adhere to reason and command, restrain from what reason and law forbid, restrain from manifesting grief, agitation and impatience. The word being the contrary of jaz'a (manifestation of grief and agitation).. . Sabar (prf. 3rd. p.m. sing.): He bore with patience.. Sabaruu (prf. 3rd. p.m. plu.): They bore patiently, patiently preserved.. Sabartum (prf. 2nd. p.m. plu.): You patiently preserved.. Sabarnaa (imp. 1st. p.m. plu.): We patiently preserved.. Yasbir (imp. 3rd. p.m. sing. fuss.): He patiently preserves.. Tasbiru (imp. 2nd. p.m. sing. fuss.): You have patience.. Tasbiruuna/Tasbiruu (acc. /imp. 2nd. p.m. plu. juss.): You will patiently preserve.. . Nasbira imp. neg. 1st. p. plu. ): We will not at all remain content.. Nasbiranna (imp. 1st. p. plu.): We will surely endure patiently.. Isbir (prt. m. sing.): Preserve thou (in doing good); Bear patiently; Wait thou patiently.. Isbiruu (prt. in. plu.): Be patiently preserving.. Saabiruu (prt. m. plu. III): Strive to excel in being patiently preserving.. Istabir (prt. in. plu. sing.): Be steadfast.. Sabrun/Sabran (acc./ v. n.): Patience.. Saabiruun/ Saabiriin (acc. /act. pic. plu.): Those who are calm and steadfast.. Saabiratun (act. plc. f sing.): Preserving one f.. Saabiraat (act. plc. f. plu.): Preserving women.. Asbara (elative.) : How very enduring.. Sabaar (ints. sing.): Patiently preserving.. Saabiran (act. pic. m. sing. acc.): Patient.

data.meanings: serve, worship, adore, venerate, accept the impression of a thing, obey with submissiveness or humility, approve, apply, devote, obedience, slave, keep to inseparably, subdue, assemble together, enslave.
data.sentence: The word عَبْدَنَا comes from the root ع ب د and is associated with the meanings: serve, worship, adore, venerate, accept the impression of a thing, obey with submissiveness or humility, approve, apply, devote, obedience, slave, keep to inseparably, subdue, assemble together, enslave.
The word الْأَيْدِ comes from the root ا ي د and is associated with the meanings: to support/strengthen/confirm.

data.meanings: to come back from, repent, set (stars), repeat, return (from disobedience to obedience), echo, alight at night.
data.sentence: The word أَوَّابٌ comes from the root ا و ب and is associated with the meanings: to come back from, repent, set (stars), repeat, return (from disobedience to obedience), echo, alight at night.
